AstralPaw.name: Astral Paw
AstralPaw.description: Ever wanted to be a cosmic cat burglar? Well, meow's your chance! This spell lets you manipulate objects from afar like you're some kind of spectral kitten batting at a yarn ball of reality.
AstralPaw.effect: Lets you play grabby hands with anything under 50 lbs that you can see. Great for snagging loot or pantsing your enemies from a safe distance.
AstralPaw.target: 100 ft range, line of sight required. No, squinting really hard doesn't extend the range.
AstralPaw.duration: Up to 5 minutes, or until you get distracted by a shiny object.

BitchWhat.name: Bitch, What?
BitchWhat.description: The magical equivalent of 'Did I stutter?' This spell turns you into a walking, talking 'No U' card.
BitchWhat.effect: Makes you fireproof and about as responsive to blunt force as your ex's heart. Also cranks up your sass-o-meter by 50%. Use with caution, or don't. I'm not your mom.
BitchWhat.target: Self. Who else would you want to make this insufferable?

LegionnairesOfTheDamned.name: Legionnaires of the Damned
LegionnairesOfTheDamned.description: Because nothing says 'I'm a responsible summoner' like conjuring up a squad of eternally pissed-off ghost soldiers.
LegionnairesOfTheDamned.effect: Summons 5 spectral warriors who are really, REALLY not happy about being here. They'll fight for you, but don't expect small talk.
LegionnairesOfTheDamned.target: 60 ft range. Any further and they might decide it's not worth the commute.
LegionnairesOfTheDamned.duration: 10 minutes, or until they unionize and demand better working conditions.

ClockworkTriplicate.name: Clockwork Triplicate
ClockworkTriplicate.description: Ever wanted to be in three places at once? No? Well, tough luck, because that's exactly what this spell does.
ClockworkTriplicate.effect: Creates 3 robot duplicates of you. They can do tasks or explode. Sometimes both, if you're really unlucky.
ClockworkTriplicate.target: 30 ft range. Any further and the warranty doesn't cover it.
ClockworkTriplicate.duration: Until destroyed or 1 hour. Whichever comes first, and let's face it, it's probably destruction.

LaundryDay.name: Laundry Day
LaundryDay.description: For when you absolutely, positively need to strip someone of their dignity... and their armor.
LaundryDay.effect: Gradually strips an enemy of their armor over 3 rounds. It's like a magical striptease, but way less fun for the target.
LaundryDay.target: 40 ft range. Close enough to see the look of confusion on their face.
LaundryDay.duration: 3 rounds of increasingly embarrassing wardrobe malfunctions.

MagicMissile.name: Magic Missile
MagicMissile.description: The Toyota Corolla of spells. It's not flashy, but it gets the job done.
MagicMissile.manaCost: 1 per missile. It's like a magical vending machine of pain.
MagicMissile.effect: Fires magical darts that never miss. Each one deals 1d4+1 force damage. Intelligence modifier affects damage because, let's face it, even magic respects nerds.
MagicMissile.target: 120 ft range. If you can't hit them from here, maybe consider a career change.
MagicMissile.duration: Instantaneous. Blink and you'll miss it. They won't, though.

Mute.name: Mute
Mute.description: Perfect for shutting up that one party member who won't stop quoting movies, or for making your enemies play the world's worst game of charades.
Mute.effect: Silences a target, preventing them from casting spells or making loud noises. Does not, unfortunately, work on your own thoughts.
Mute.target: 50 ft range. Just far enough that you can't hear them cursing you out.

PuddleJumper.name: Puddle Jumper
PuddleJumper.description: For when you need to make a dramatic exit but all you've got is a puddle and a dream.
PuddleJumper.effect: Teleports caster and up to 3 allies to any visible location within range. May cause mild nausea and an inexplicable craving for lily pads.
PuddleJumper.target: 200 ft range. That's a lot of puddle to jump.
PuddleJumper.duration: Instantaneous. One second you're here, the next you're over there wondering why your shoes are wet.

Rigorous.name: Rigorous
Rigorous.description: The magical equivalent of 'I'm rubber, you're glue'. Finally, a spell for the playground tactician in all of us.
Rigorous.effect: Reflects the next debuff or negative spell back to the attacker. Does not, unfortunately, work on emotional damage.
Rigorous.target: Self. Because sometimes the best defense is a good 'No U'.
Rigorous.duration: Until triggered or 10 minutes. Whichever comes first, usually right after you forget you cast it.

SecondChance.name: Second Chance
SecondChance.description: Because sometimes your first chance went so badly, you need divine intervention to fix it.
SecondChance.effect: Revives a fallen creature with 50% of their health for a brief period. Does not, unfortunately, revive their will to live.
SecondChance.target: Touch. Hope you're not squeamish about poking dead things.
SecondChance.duration: 5 minutes of borrowed time. Use it wisely, or don't. It's not my second chance.

Skedaddle.name: Skedaddle
Skedaddle.description: When you need to nope out of a situation faster than you can say 'It wasn't me'.
Skedaddle.effect: Allows caster to instantly teleport to a safe location they can see. Does not guarantee the location will stay safe after you arrive.
Skedaddle.target: Line of sight. If you can see it, you can flee to it.
Skedaddle.duration: Instantaneous. One moment you're in danger, the next you're in... probably still danger, but different danger.

WallOfFire.name: Wall of Fire
WallOfFire.description: For when a regular wall just isn't antisocial enough.
WallOfFire.effect: Creates a wall of fire 20 ft long and 5 ft high, dealing 2d6 fire damage to anyone passing through. Great for barbecues, terrible for group hugs.
WallOfFire.target: 50 ft range. Close enough to feel the heat, far enough to pretend it's not your fault.

Rubber.name: Rubber
Rubber.description: Turn your enemies' attacks into the equivalent of hitting you with a wet noodle. Equally effective against swords and harsh criticisms.
Rubber.effect: Target becomes rubbery, reducing physical damage taken by 50%. Does not, unfortunately, make you bouncy.
Rubber.target: Touch. Get ready to feel weirdly moist.
Rubber.duration: 5 minutes of being basically a human stress ball.

GetOutOfJail.name: Get Out of Jail
GetOutOfJail.description: The magical equivalent of a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, but with 100% more chance of interdimensional shenanigans.
GetOutOfJail.effect: Teleports the caster out of confinement or bindings to a safe space they can see. Does not teleport away criminal records or regrets.
GetOutOfJail.target: 500 ft range. If you can't find safety within 500 ft, maybe jail is the safer option.
GetOutOfJail.duration: Instantaneous. One second you're in chains, the next you're free and probably very, very lost.

HealSpell.name: Heal Spell
HealSpell.description: When kissing the boo-boo just won't cut it anymore.
HealSpell.effect: Restores 20% of the target's maximum health. Warning: Does not heal emotional damage or bad fashion choices.
HealSpell.target: Touch. Time to get uncomfortably close to your injured ally.
HealSpell.duration: Instantaneous. Blink and you'll miss the miracle. They won't, though.

HealCritter.name: Heal Critter
HealCritter.description: For when you need to play magical veterinarian to your animal companion or that random squirrel you befriended.
HealCritter.effect: Restores 30% of a pet or small animal's health. Does not work on large animals because, let's face it, they're probably trying to eat you.
HealCritter.target: Touch. Hope you're good at petting angry, injured animals.
HealCritter.duration: Instantaneous. One second they're hurt, the next they're ready to cause more trouble.

Hole.name: Hole
Hole.description: Create your own portable plot hole! Great for escaping tight spots or creating new, more exciting tight spots.
Hole.effect: Creates a hole up to 2 ft in diameter through barriers less than 1 ft thick. Not responsible for any Looney Tunes-style mishaps.
Hole.target: 30 ft range. Any further and you're just digging your own grave.
Hole.duration: 5 minutes. Use it quick before reality patches itself.

MinionArmy.name: Minion Army
MinionArmy.description: Summon your own personal flash mob of combatants! Great for battles, terrible for stealth missions.
MinionArmy.effect: Summons 20 minions with low health that engage enemies. Can distract or overwhelm foes. May also break into spontaneous dance numbers.
MinionArmy.target: 100 ft range. Any further and they'll form a union and demand better working conditions.
MinionArmy.duration: 30 minutes of chaotic, questionably helpful assistance.

Torch.name: Torch
Torch.description: For when you need a light and setting your party's wizard on fire is frowned upon.
Torch.effect: Produces a floating light that follows the caster, illuminating a 20 ft radius. Does not, unfortunately, make you any brighter mentally.
Torch.target: Self. Congratulations, you're now a human lighthouse.
Torch.duration: 1 hour of being slightly less likely to trip over your own feet in the dark.

TwinkleToes.name: Twinkle Toes
TwinkleToes.description: Turn your target into a graceful gazelle... or a clumsy elephant trying to be a graceful gazelle.
TwinkleToes.effect: Enhances the target's agility and movement speed by 25%. Side effects may include spontaneous tap dancing and an irresistible urge to pirouette.
TwinkleToes.target: Touch. Time to get handsy with your soon-to-be-graceful friend.
TwinkleToes.duration: 10 minutes of being marginally less likely to face-plant during combat.

LoopDeLoop.name: Loop-de-Loop
LoopDeLoop.description: The magical equivalent of saying 'Tag, you're it!' but with more existential confusion.
LoopDeLoop.effect: Causes the target and the caster to switch places when triggered. Great for confusing enemies, terrible for maintaining a sense of object permanence.
LoopDeLoop.target: 50 ft range. Any further and you risk leaving parts behind.
LoopDeLoop.duration: Instantaneous when triggered, but the confusion lasts much longer.

BangBro.name: Bang Bro
BangBro.description: Create a harmless explosion that's all bang and no bite. Perfect for when you need a distraction or really want to annoy your neighbors.
BangBro.effect: Creates a loud, harmless explosion that distracts all enemies within a 30 ft radius. May cause temporary deafness and a strong desire to yell 'WHAT?'
BangBro.target: 100 ft range. Far enough to pretend it wasn't you.
BangBro.duration: Instantaneous, but the ringing in everyone's ears lasts much longer.

BlackNimbus.name: Black Nimbus
BlackNimbus.description: Summon your own personal rain cloud of doom. Great for sneaking, terrible for your mood.
BlackNimbus.effect: Covers an area of 30 ft radius in darkness, reducing visibility to near zero and making it hard for enemies to target allies. Also great for dramatic entrances.
BlackNimbus.target: 80 ft range. Any further and you're just making regular nighttime.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: Make your enemies scream like they just walked in on their parents... you know what, never mind.
Fear.effect: Induces extreme fear in all enemies within a 30 ft radius, causing them to flee for the duration. Does not work on creatures without self-preservation instincts or teenagers.
Fear.target: Self (30 ft radius). Hope you're not afraid of the dark, 'cause you're the epicenter of terror now, baby.
Fear.duration: 1 minute of pure, unadulterated panic. For them, not you. Hopefully.

Ping.name: Ping
Ping.description: The magical equivalent of shouting 'Marco!' and having everything shout 'Polo!' back at you.
Ping.effect: Emits a pulse that detects and reveals all hidden or invisible entities within a 100 ft radius. Great for finding lost keys, terrible for maintaining any sense of privacy.
Ping.target: Self. Hope you're ready to know WAY too much about your surroundings.
Ping.duration: Instantaneous, but the awkwardness of knowing where everyone's hiding lasts much longer.

ProtectiveShell.name: Protective Shell
ProtectiveShell.description: Encase yourself in a magical bubble. Great for protection, terrible for social interactions.
ProtectiveShell.effect: Creates a magical shell around the target that absorbs up to 20 points of damage. Does not protect against emotional damage or bad puns.
ProtectiveShell.target: Touch. Time to get up close and personal with your soon-to-be-shelled friend.
ProtectiveShell.duration: 10 minutes of being slightly less squishy.

Tripper.name: Tripper
Tripper.description: For when you want to turn the dungeon into a slapstick comedy routine.
Tripper.effect: Creates magical banana peels in a 30 ft radius, potentially damaging or incapacitating enemies. May also affect allies because magic doesn't discriminate against clumsiness.
Tripper.target: 30 ft range. Close enough to enjoy the show, far enough to pretend it wasn't you.
Tripper.duration: Instantaneous, but the hilarity lasts until someone breaks a hip.
